TOOLTIP.NAME_FILTER: 리소스 이름을 필터링합니다. 비워두거나 '**'를 사용하여 모두 일치시키세요. 'library/**'는 'library' 아래의 리소스와만 일치합니다. 더 많은 패턴은 사용자 가이드를 참고하세요.
TOOLTIP.TAG_FILTER: 리소스의 태그/버전 부분을 필터링합니다. 비워두거나 '**'를 사용하여 모두 일치시키세요. '1.0*'은 '1.0'으로 시작하는 태그와만 일치합니다. 더 많은 패턴은 사용자 가이드를 참고하세요..
TOOLTIP.PUSH_BASED: 로컬 하버에서 원격 레지스트리로 리소스를 푸시합니다.
TOOLTIP.PULL_BASED: 원격 레지스트리에서 로컬 하버로 리소스를 가져옵니다.
TOOLTIP.DESTINATION_NAMESPACE: 대상 네임스페이스를 지정합니다. 비어 있는 경우 리소스는 소스와 동일한 네임스페이스 아래에 배치됩니다.
TOOLTIP.OVERRIDE: 동일한 이름의 리소스가 있는 경우 대상에서 리소스를 재정의할지 여부를 지정합니다.
TOOLTIP.EMAIL: 이메일은 name@example.com과 같은 유효한 이메일 주소여야 합니다.
TOOLTIP.USER_NAME: 특수 문자를 포함할 수 없으며 최대 길이는 255자여야 합니다.
TOOLTIP.PASSWORD: 비밀번호는 대문자 1개, 소문자 1개, 숫자 1개를 포함하여 8~20자 길이여야 합니다.
TOOLTIP.REPO_TOOLTIP: 사용자는 이 모드에서 이미지에 어떤 작업도 할 수 없습니다.
TOOLTIP.OIDC_SCOPE: 인증 시 OIDC 서버로 전송되는 범위입니다. 'openid' 및 'offline_access'를 포함해야 합니다. Google을 사용하는 경우 이 필드에서 'offline_access'를 제거하십시오.
TOOLTIP.OIDC_VERIFYCERT: 자체 서명된 인증서를 통해 OIDC 서버를 호스팅하는 경우 이 확인란의 선택을 취소합니다.
TOOLTIP.OIDC_GROUP_CLAIM: The name of Claim in the ID token whose value is the list of group names.
TOOLTIP.OIDC_GROUP_CLAIM_WARNING: 문자, 숫자, 밑줄만 포함할 수 있으며 입력 길이는 256자 이하여야 합니다.
TOOLTIP.OIDC_AUTOONBOARD: 사용자가 사용자 이름을 변경할 수 없도록 온보딩 화면을 건너뜁니다. 사용자 이름은 ID 토큰에서 제공됩니다.
TOOLTIP.OIDC_USER_CLAIM: The name of the claim in the ID Token where the username is retrieved from. If not specified, it will default to 'name'
TOOLTIP.NEW_SECRET: 8자 이상이어야 하며 대문자 1개, 소문자 1개, 숫자 1개 이상이어야 합니다.

PROFILE.TITLE: 사용자 계정
PROFILE.ADMIN_RENAME_TIP: 사용자 이름을 "admin@harbor.local"로 변경하려면 버튼을 선택하십시오. 이 작업은 취소할 수 없습니다.
PROFILE.RENAME_CONFIRM_INFO: 경고, 이름을 admin@harbor.local로 변경하면 취소할 수 없습니다.
PROFILE.CLI_PASSWORD_TIP: docker/helm cli를 사용하여 Harbor에 액세스할 때 이 cli  secret을 암호로 사용할 수 있습니다.
PROFILE.CONFIRM_TITLE_CLI_GENERATE: Are you sure you can regenerate secret?
PROFILE.CONFIRM_BODY_CLI_GENERATE: cli secret을 재생성하면 이전 cli secret은 폐기됩니다.

CHANGE_PWD.TITLE: 비밀번호 변경
CHANGE_PWD.PASS_TIPS: 대문자 1개, 소문자 1개, 숫자 1개로 구성된 8-128 자 길이

USER.EXISTING_PASSWORD: 새 비밀번호는 기존 비밀번호와 같을 수 없습니다.
USER.UNKNOWN_TIP: Please verify whether the user has admin status through the Identity Provider System if the value is "Unknown"

PROJECT.NAME: 프로젝트 이름
PROJECT.NAME_TOOLTIP: 프로젝트 이름은 소문자, 숫자 및 ._-를 포함하여 1~255자 길이여야 하며 문자 또는 숫자로 시작해야 합니다.
PROJECT.UNKNOWN_ERROR: 프로젝트 생성간에 예기치 못한 오류가 발생하였습니다.
PROJECT.FAILED_TO_DELETE_PROJECT: Project contains repositories or replication rules or helm-charts cannot be deleted.
PROJECT.INLINE_HELP_PUBLIC: 프로젝트가 공개로 설정되면 누구나 이 프로젝트의 리포지토리에 대한 읽기 권한이 있으며 사용자는 이 프로젝트에서 이미지를 가져오기 전에 "docker 로그인"을 실행할 필요가 없습니다.
PROJECT.STORAGE_QUOTA_TIP: 스토리지 할당량의 상한선은 '1024TB'로 제한되는 정수 값만 사용합니다. 무제한 할당량을 사용하려면 '-1'을 입력하세요.
PROJECT.PROXY_CACHE_TOOLTIP: Enable this to allow this project to act as a pull-through cache for a particular target registry instance. Harbor can only act a proxy for DockerHub, Docker Registry, Harbor, Aws ECR, Azure ACR, Quay and Google GCR registries.

PROJECT_CONFIG.PUBLIC_POLICY: 프로젝트 레지스트리를 공개하면 모든 저장소에 모든 사람이 액세스할 수 있습니다.
PROJECT_CONFIG.CONTENT_TRUST_POLCIY: Allow only verified images to be deployed.
PROJECT_CONFIG.PREVENT_VULNERABLE_1: Prevent images with vulnerability severity of
PROJECT_CONFIG.AUTOSCAN_POLICY: Automatically scan images when they are pushed to the project registry.

CONFIG.TITLE: Configuration
CONFIG.LABEL: Labels
CONFIG.CONFIRM_SUMMARY: Some changes have not been saved. Do you want to discard them?
CONFIG.INSECURE_TOOLTIP: Determine whether to verify the certificate of the Email server. Uncheck this box when the Email server uses a self-signed or untrusted certificate.
CONFIG.SSL_TOOLTIP: Enable SSL for email server connection

TOOLTIP.VERIFY_REMOTE_CERT: Determine whether the image replication should verify the certificate of a remote Harbor registry. Uncheck this box when the remote registry uses a self-signed or untrusted certificate.
TOOLTIP.AUTH_MODE: By default the authentication mode is database, i.e. the credentials are stored in a local database. Set it to LDAP if you want to verify a user's credential against an LDAP server.
TOOLTIP.LDAP_SEARCH_DN: A user's DN who has the permission to search the LDAP/AD server. If your LDAP/AD server does not support anonymous search, you should configure this DN and ldap_search_pwd.
TOOLTIP.LDAP_BASE_DN: The base DN from which to look up a user in LDAP/AD.
TOOLTIP.LDAP_UID: The attribute used in a search to match a user. It could be uid, cn, email, sAMAccountName or other attributes depending on your LDAP/AD.
TOOLTIP.LDAP_SCOPE: The scope to search for users.
TOOLTIP.TOKEN_EXPIRATION: The expiration time (in minutes) of a token created by the token service. Default is 30 minutes.
TOOLTIP.ROBOT_NAME_PREFIX: Prefixed string for each robot name,and default value is 'robot$'
TOOLTIP.ROBOT_TOKEN_EXPIRATION: The expiration time (in days) of the token of the robot account, Default is 30 days. Show the number of days converted from minutes and rounds down
TOOLTIP.PRO_CREATION_RESTRICTION: The flag to define what users have permission to create projects. By default, everyone can create a project. Set to 'Admin Only' so that only an administrator can create a project.
TOOLTIP.ROOT_CERT_DOWNLOAD: Download the root certificate of registry.
TOOLTIP.SCANNING_POLICY: Set image scanning policy based on different requirements. 'None': No active policy; 'Daily At': Triggering scanning at the specified time everyday.
TOOLTIP.REPO_TOOLTIP: Users can not do any operations to the images in this mode.
TOOLTIP.WEBHOOK_TOOLTIP: Enable webhooks to receive callbacks at your designated endpoints when certain actions such as image or chart being pushed, pulled, deleted, scanned are performed
TOOLTIP.HOURLY_CRON: Run once an hour, beginning of hour. Equivalent to 0 0 * * * *.
TOOLTIP.WEEKLY_CRON: Run once a week, midnight between Sat/Sun. Equivalent to 0 0 0 * * 0.
TOOLTIP.DAILY_CRON: Run once a day, midnight. Equivalent to 0 0 0 * * *.

LDAP.LDAP_GROUP_BASE_DN_INFO: The base DN from which to look up a group in LDAP/AD. This field cannot be empty if you need to enable the LDAP group related feature.
LDAP.LDAP_GROUP_FILTER_INFO: The filter to search for LDAP/AD groups. For OpenLDAP: objectclass=groupOfNames. For Active Directory: objectclass=group. This field cannot be empty if you need the LDAP group-related feature.
LDAP.LDAP_GROUP_GID_INFO: The attribute used in a search to match a user, it could be uid, cn or other attributes depending on your LDAP/AD. The group in Harbor is named with this attribute by default. This field cannot be empty if you need to enable the LDAP group related feature.
LDAP.LDAP_GROUP_ADMIN_DN_INFO: Specify an LDAP group DN. All LDAP user in this group will have harbor admin privilege. Keep it blank if you do not want to.
LDAP.LDAP_GROUP_MEMBERSHIP_INFO: The attribute indicates the membership of LDAP group, default value is memberof, in some LDAP server it could be "ismemberof". This field cannot be empty if you need to enable the LDAP group related feature.
LDAP.GROUP_SCOPE_INFO: The scope to search for groups, select Subtree by default.

OIDC.OIDC_REDIREC_URL: Please make sure the Redirect URI on the OIDC provider is set to
OIDC.OIDC_SETNAMECONTENT: You must create a Harbor username the first time when authenticating via a third party(OIDC).This will be used within Harbor to be associated with projects, roles, etc.
OIDC.OIDC_ADMIN_GROUP_INFO: Specify an OIDC admin group name. All OIDC users in this group will have harbor admin privilege. Keep it blank if you do not want to.

ABOUT.COPYRIGHT: Project Harbor is an an open source trusted cloud native registry project that stores, signs, and scans content. Harbor extends the open source Docker Distribution by adding the functionalities usually required by users such as security, identity and management. Harbor supports advanced features such as user management, access control, activity monitoring, and replication between instances. Having a registry closer to the build and run environment can also improve image transfer efficiency.
ABOUT.TRADEMARK: VMware is a registered trademark or trademark of VMware, Inc. in the United States and other jurisdictions. All other marks and names mentioned herein may be trademark of their respective companies.

UNKNOWN_ERROR: Unknown errors have occurred. Please try again later.
UNAUTHORIZED_ERROR: Your session is invalid or has expired. You need to sign in to continue your action.
REPO_READ_ONLY: Harbor is set to read-only mode, Deleting repository, artifact, tag and pushing image will be deactivated under read-only mode.
FORBIDDEN_ERROR: You do not have the proper privileges to perform the action.
GENERAL_ERROR: Errors have occurred when performing service call: {{param}}.
BAD_REQUEST_ERROR: We are unable to perform your action because of a bad request.
NOT_FOUND_ERROR: Your request cannot be completed because the object does not exist.
CONFLICT_ERROR: We are unable to perform your action because your submission has conflicts.
PRECONDITION_FAILED: We are unable to perform your action because of a precondition failure.
SERVER_ERROR: We are unable to perform your action because internal server errors have occurred.

GC.MSG_SCHEDULE_SET: Garbage Collection schedule has been set
GC.MSG_SCHEDULE_RESET: Garbage Collection schedule has been reset
GC.DELETE_UNTAGGED: Allow garbage collection on untagged artifacts
GC.EXPLAIN: GC is a compute intensive operation that may impact registry performance

RETAG.TIP_REPO: A repository name is broken up into path components. A component of a repository name must be at least one lowercase, alpha-numeric characters, optionally separated by periods, dashes or underscores. More strictly, it must match the regular expression [a-z0-9]+(?:[._-][a-z0-9]+)*.If a repository name has two or more path components, they must be separated by a forward slash ('/').The total length of a repository name, including slashes, must be less the 256 characters.
RETAG.TIP_TAG: A tag is a label applied to a Docker image in a repository. Tags are how various images in a repository are distinguished from each other.It need to match Regex: (`[\w][\w.-]{0,127}`)

CVE_ALLOWLIST.SYS_ALLOWLIST_EXPLAIN: System allowlist allows vulnerabilities in this list to be ignored when calculating the vulnerability of an image.
CVE_ALLOWLIST.ADD_SYS: Add CVE IDs to the system allowlist
CVE_ALLOWLIST.WARNING_SYS: The system CVE allowlist has expired. You can enable the allowlist by extending the expiration date.
CVE_ALLOWLIST.WARNING_PRO: The project CVE allowlist has expired. You can enable the allowlist by extending the expiration date.
CVE_ALLOWLIST.PRO_ALLOWLIST_EXPLAIN: Project allowlist allows vulnerabilities in this list to be ignored in this project when pushing and pulling images.
CVE_ALLOWLIST.PRO_OR_SYS: You can either use the default allowlist configured at the system level or click on 'Project allowlist' to create a new allowlist
CVE_ALLOWLIST.MERGE_INTO: Add individual CVE IDs before clicking 'COPY FROM SYSTEM' to add system allowlist as well.

TAG_RETENTION.ADD_RULE_HELP_2: Tag retention polices run once a day.

TAG_RETENTION.BY_WHAT: By artifact count or number of days

TAG_RETENTION.TAG_SEPARATOR: Enter multiple comma separated tags, tag*, or **. Optionally include all untagged artifacts when applying the ‘including’ or ‘excluding’ selector by checking the box above.
TAG_RETENTION.RETENTION_RUN_EXPLAIN: Executing the retention policy can have adverse effects to the artifacts in this project and affected artifact tags will be deleted. Press CANCEL and use a DRY RUN to simulate the effect of this policy. Otherwise press RUN to proceed.
TAG_RETENTION.RETENTION_RUN_ABORTED_EXPLAIN: This retention run has been aborted. Artifacts already deleted are irreversible. You can initiate another run to continue to delete artifacts. In order to simulate a run, you can use the “DRY RUN”.
TAG_RETENTION.RULE_NAME_6: the artifacts pulled within the last {{number}} days
TAG_RETENTION.RULE_NAME_7: the artifacts pushed within the last {{number}} days
TAG_RETENTION.RULE_TEMPLATE_6: the artifacts pulled within the last # days
TAG_RETENTION.RULE_TEMPLATE_7: the artifacts pushed within the last # days
TAG_RETENTION.SCHEDULE_WARNING: Executing retention policy results in the irreversible effect of deleting artifacts from the Harbor project.  Please double check all policies before scheduling.

IMMUTABLE_TAG.ADD_SUBTITLE: Specify a tag immutability rule for this project.  Note: all tag immutability rules are first independently calculated and then unioned to capture the final set of immutable tags.

P2P_PROVIDER.CRITERIA_EXPLAIN: As specified in 'Deployment security' section under Configuration tab
P2P_PROVIDER.SKIP_CERT_VERIFY: Check this box to skip certificate verification when the remote provider uses a self-signed or untrusted certificate.
P2P_PROVIDER.NAME_TOOLTIP: Policy name should be at least 2 characters long with lower case characters, numbers and ._- and must be start with characters or numbers.
P2P_PROVIDER.NEED_HELP: Please ask your system admin to add a provider first

SYSTEM_ROBOT.SECRET: Secret should be 8-20 characters long with at least 1 uppercase, 1 lowercase and 1 number.
SYSTEM_ROBOT.ENABLE_SUMMARY: Do you want to enable robot {{param}}?
SYSTEM_ROBOT.DISABLE_SUMMARY: Do you want to deactivate robot {{param}}?
SYSTEM_ROBOT.REFRESH_SECRET_SUMMARY: Refresh the robot account secret automatically, or optionally open the details to manually specify a new secret
SYSTEM_ROBOT.PROJECTS_MODAL_SUMMARY: There are the projects covered by this robot account.
SYSTEM_ROBOT.CREATE_ROBOT_SUMMARY: Create a system Robot Account that will cover specific projects. Choose "Cover all projects" to be applied to all existing and future projects
SYSTEM_ROBOT.EDIT_ROBOT_SUMMARY: Edit a system Robot Account. Choose "Cover all projects" to be applied to all exiting and future projects
SYSTEM_ROBOT.EXPIRATION_TIME_EXPLAIN: The expiration time(in days and the starting point is creation time) of the token of the robot account. For being never expired, please enter "-1".
SYSTEM_ROBOT.COVER_ALL_EXPLAIN: Check to be applied to all existing and future projects
SYSTEM_ROBOT.COVER_ALL_SUMMARY: All current and future projects selected.
SYSTEM_ROBOT.CREATE_PROJECT_ROBOT_SUMMARY: Create a robot account for this project
SYSTEM_ROBOT.EDIT_PROJECT_ROBOT_SUMMARY: Edit a robot account for this project
SYSTEM_ROBOT.NAME_TOOLTIP: Robot name should be 1~255 characters long with lower case characters, numbers and ._- and must be start with characters or numbers.
SYSTEM_ROBOT.ENABLE_NEW_SECRET: Enable this option to manually specify a new secret
SYSTEM_ROBOT.FINAL_PROJECT_NAME_TIP: The final project robot name consists of the prefix,the project name,a plus mark and the current input value
SYSTEM_ROBOT.FINAL_SYSTEM_NAME_TIP: The final system robot name consists of the prefix and the current input value
SYSTEM_ROBOT.PUSH_PERMISSION_TOOLTIP: Push permission can not work alone, it must work with pull permission

ACCESSORY.DELETION_SUMMARY_ACCESSORY: Do you want to delete all the accessories of the artifact {{param}}?
ACCESSORY.DELETION_SUMMARY_ONE_ACCESSORY: Do you want to delete the accessory(s) {{param}}?
